thread.title: HIGH SCHOOL: Savannah Christian cruises past Jenkins County |
thread.title_full: HIGH SCHOOL: Savannah Christian cruises past Jenkins County | savannahnow.com

author: ANTHONY STASTNY AND NATHAN DEEN
title: HIGH SCHOOL: Savannah Christian cruises past Jenkins County |
text:
By ANTHONY STASTNY AND NATHAN DEEN , COMPILED BY NATHAN DOMINITZ MILLEN — Demetris Robertson rushed for 99 yards, scored on a 48-yard run and returned an interception 63 yards as Savannah Christian rolled over Jenkins County 42-7 on Friday.
The win puts SCPS at 6-1 overall and 5-0 in Region 3-A.
Robertson carried the ball six times, and AJ Davis rushed 11 times for 39 yards and scored two touchdowns.
After a scoreless first quarter, the Raiders tallied 28 points in the second and 14 in the third.
Davis started the scoring with a 1-yard run in the second quarter. Then Ben Jackson scored from the 2 before Seth Bruno caught a 6-yard TD pass,
Later, Robertson scored from 48 yards out, and Jackson tallied from the 13 and Davis scored from the 3.
For Jenkins County, Tyler Washington scored on a 77-yard run.
SCPS 0 28 14 0 — 42
JC 0 0 0 7 — 7
SCPS—AJ Davis 1 run (Brice O’Brien kick)
SCPS—Ben Jackson 2 run (O’Brien kick)
SCPS—Seth Bruno 6 pass from Jordan Grant 6 (O’Brien kick)
SCPS—Demetris Robertson 48 run (O’Brien kick)
SCPS—Ben Jackson 13 run (O’Brien kick)
SCPS—Davis 3 run (O’Brien kick)
JC—Tyler Washington 77 run (Desmeion Robbins kick)
HILTON HEAD PREP 28,
ST. ANDREW’S 20
HILTON HEAD ISLAND, S.C. — Caleb Tymchyshyn scored three touchdowns, but St. Andrew’s fell to Hilton Head Prep.
Tymchyshyn had 69 yards rushing for SAS.
Tyler Fox led Hilton Head with 183 yards rushing. He scored two three downs, two rushing and one passing.
BEACH 33, ISLANDS 14
Joe Burke rushed 150 yards and three touchdowns, including a 64-yard scoring run, as Beach beat Islands.
Andrew Oliver caught a pair of touchdown passes from quarterback Rashamal Cooper.
For Islands, Cole Donahue scored on a 1-yard run and threw a 32-yard scoring pass to Kaleb Scott.
BRANTLEY COUNTY 35,
TATTNALL COUNTY 28
REIDSVILLE — Brantley County quarterback Mikel Collins accounted for four of the Blue Herons’ five touchdowns in a win at region foe Tattnall County.
Collins carried 28 times for 210 yards and two rushing touchdowns while completing 10 of 14 passes for 119 yards and two more scores. His highlight was a 57-yard touchdown run that tied the game at 7-7 in the first quarter.
Brantley earned its first win in Region 1-AAA, improving to 4-3 overall and 1-3 in the league. Tattnall is 3-5, with all of its losses coming in region play.
Brantley 14 13 8 0—35
Tattnall 7 14 0 7—28
T—Darius Mincey 3 run (Florentino Santiago kick)
B—Mikel Collins 57 run (Peyton Henderson kick)

B—Cameron Flowers fumble recovered in end zone (Collins run good)
T—Johnson 6 run (Santiago kick)
PINEWOOD CHRISTIAN 38,
TRINITY CHRISTIAN 9
DUBLIN — Sophomore quarterback Jeffrey Young was 13 of 17 for 259 yards passing and three touchdowns as visiting Pinewood Christian improved to 9-0, 2-0 in GISA Region 2-AAA.
Cameron Dutton had three receptions for 147 yards, including touchdowns of 81 and 45 yards. Receiver Blake Shuman carried the ball twice for 65 yards, including a 59-yard TD, and also caught a 27-yard scoring toss from Young.
Middle linebacker Matthew Floyd had 12 total tackles for Pinewood. Kicker Caleb Conley connected on a 24-yard field goal and three extra points.
PC 0 20 8 10 — 38
TC 0 0 9 0 — 9

FREDERICA 41,
BULLOCH ACADEMY 31
ST. SIMONS ISLAND — JaShawn Sheffield returned a kickoff 79 yards for a touchdown and John Mitchell Brock kicked a 22-yard field goal for two late scores to lift host Frederica Academy (5-3, 2-1 GISA Region 2-AAA).
Bulloch Academy (7-2, 1-1 region) was led by Jarves Williams, who rushed 17 times for 144 yards, including a 7-yard TD.
Bulloch finished with 56 rushes for 297 yards, while Frederica had 21 for 260. Bulloch had 361 total yards on offense, to 387 for the host squad.
Each team lost three of four fumbles.

FA—Brock 22 FG
BURKE COUNTY 48,
WINDSOR FOREST 0
WAYNESBORO — Living on the edge seemingly every week with white-knuckle finishes, Burke County welcomed a rout with arms almost as wide open as the running lanes.
Burke County, which has played five one-score games this season, wasted hardly any time to turn Friday’s game into a blowout, rolling by Windsor Forest at the Bear Den.
“It was good to get one that you could consider a breather,” Burke County coach Eric Parker said. “But you know what? I’ve just been telling everybody I feel really good about the way we came out and jumped on this team and played great almost every snap.”
Cameron Holmes scored three touchdowns and the Burke County defense surrendered only 89 yards as the Bears moved to 6-2 overall and 1-1 in Region 3-AAAA.
Both the offensive and defensive lines controlled the game.
The Bears met few if any obstacles in the romp, winning the yard battle 272-20 at the half and the score 34-0 to bring a running clock for the entire second half.
Only one week after falling seven yards short of the end zone in a just-missed rally from 14 down at Liberty County, Burke County scored on five of six first-half possessions.
When Windsor Forest (1-6, 0-2) had the ball, it didn’t keep it long. Burke County clogged the lanes and stepped forward to stuff runs.
The Knights didn’t pick up a first down until 3:39 remained in the first half. They also had the same amount of penalty yards as offensive yards (20) in the opening two quarters.
— Wayne Staats, Morris News Service
